main event: Two lights resembling small aircraft were observed in Beverly, Massachusetts in 1957, emitting colored lights and flying together for 7-10 minutes.
interesting points: The lights did not disappear at the time of the report and were observed for a substantial duration of 7-10 minutes.
The report suggests the possibility of an airborne beacon light, indicating a potential prosaic explanation.
It was noted that the lights either separated on clouds or were in formation on clouds, adding complexity to the observation.
The sighting took place at 0615L, indicating it was in the early morning hours.
The report does not mention any photographs to support the observation.
sighted object: two lights resembling small aircraft emitting colored lights
